docs.title: Welcome to the Joke API
docs.text: Easily fetch and submit jokes with our public API.

docs.title: What is the Joke API?
docs.text:
The Joke API is a simple, developer-friendly interface that allows you to:

  • Get a random joke
  • Submit your own jokes
  • Explore the available endpoints
  • Contribute to the project

docs.title: Quick Links
docs.text:
• Get Started
  • API Reference
  • Code Examples
  • FAQ
  • Contribute

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text:
All endpoints are available under:

http://localhost:8000/

Or replace localhost:8000 with your deployed domain.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• No Auth Required – Jump right in!
  • FastAPI-powered – Super fast performance
  • Supports JSON only – Simple, consistent responses
  • Community Contributions – Add your own jokes

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
Explore the left sidebar to navigate through:

  • 🔹 Setup instructions
  • 🔹 Endpoint documentation
  • 🔹 Language examples
  • 🔹 Contribution guide

docs.title: Built With
docs.text:
• FastAPI
  • MkDocs
  • Material for MkDocs

Happy coding & have a laugh!

docs.title: How to Contribute
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository.
  2. Create a new branch: git checkout -b my-new-feature.
  3. Commit your changes: git commit -am 'Add some feature'.
  4. Push to the branch: git push origin my-new-feature.
  5. Submit a pull request.

docs.title: Guidelines
docs.text:
• Ensure your code follows Python style conventions (PEP 8).
  • Add tests for your new features.
  • Update the documentation if necessary.

docs.title: Get a Random Joke
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /random-joke
  • Method: GET
  • Description: Retourne une blague aleatoire.
  • Response: 
    {
  "joke": "Pourquoi les canards ont-ils autant de plumes ? Pour couvrir leur derrière !"
}

docs.title: Submit a Joke
docs.text:
• Endpoint: /submit
  • Method: POST
  • Description: Soumet une nouvelle blague.
  • Request Body: 
    {
  "joke": "Votre blague ici"
}
  • Response: 
    {
  "message": "Joke added!",
  "total": 4
}

docs.title: Why are some jokes in French?
docs.text: Because the API was initially designed for French-speaking audiences. Future versions may support multiple languages.

docs.title: Can I delete jokes?
docs.text: Not yet. Joke management (delete/update) may be added in a future release.

docs.title: Get a Random Joke
docs.text:
• Method: GET
  • URL: /random-joke

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "joke": "Pourquoi les canards ont-ils autant de plumes ? Pour couvrir leur derrière !"
}

docs.title: Submit a Joke
docs.text:
• Method: POST
  • URL: /submit

docs.title: Request
docs.text:
{
  "joke": "Une autre blague marrante"
}

docs.title: Response
docs.text:
{
  "message": "Joke added!",
  "total": 4
}

docs.title: Example: JavaScript (Fetch API)
docs.text:
fetch("http://localhost:8000/random-joke")
  .then(res => res.json())
  .then(data => console.log(data.joke));

docs.title: Example: Python
docs.text:
import requests

resp = requests.get("http://localhost:8000/random-joke")
print(resp.json()["joke"])

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
Currently, the Joke API is public and does not require authentication.

However, future versions may introduce API keys for rate-limiting and abuse prevention.

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
Welcome to the Joke API! 🎉

To start using the API, simply send a GET request to:

GET https://your-api-domain/random-joke

Use a tool like curl, Postman, or any HTTP client in your code.
